text: Richard Wysocki (born June 5, 1993 in Brunswick, Ohio) is an American professional disc golfer based in Fort Mill, South Carolina.Pro Worlds Notebook: Wysocki Family Matters; Lizotte's Literal Circus | Ultiworld Disc Golf Retrieved 2018-06-22. Wysocki turned pro in 2010. His career earnings are $366,409.76 (as of May 2019). Wysocki is a 2 time PDGA - World Champion and is widely regarded as one of the best players in the world, holding the second highest PDGA rating currently, after Paul McBeth. == Professional wins (107 total) == Wysocki won the PDGA Rookie of the Year Award in 2011 and the Male Player of the Year Award in 2012, the only male player to win the two back-to- back. Wysocki won the PDGA-World Championship two times (2016-2017), defeating 4x World Champ Paul McBeth both times. Also in 2016, he won the PDGA National Tour Series, the Disc Golf World Tour Points series, and the Disc Golf Pro Tour points series. === Majors (6) === {| class="wikitable" |- !Year !Tournament
